summary: The document is a payroll certification for the U.S. House of Representatives' Select Committee on Assassinations, dated 05/03/78, covering the accounting period from 04/01/78 to 04/30/78. It details the salaries of various staff members, including senior counsel, staff investigators, researchers, and administrative personnel, with salary limits ranging from a minimum of $1,200.00 to a maximum of $47,500.00.
key_findings: The document provides a detailed payroll record for the Select Committee on Assassinations for April 1978.
It includes a wide range of positions, from senior counsel and chief investigators to clerical assistants and secretaries.
Salary information reveals disparities in pay based on position and seniority, with the highest paid being the Chief Counsel and Director at $47,500.00 annually.
Some entries include remarks such as terminations or payroll changes, indicating the dynamic nature of the committee's staffing.
